intro: Maieta heterophylla, commonly known as the variable maieta, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, often hairy foliage and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant exhibits morphological variation, with leaves that can be either simple or compound, depending on the environment. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
